result.execSummary:
Bradley Eddy was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bradley Eddy was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Eddy

records.addlTxt:
8:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley Eddy not in court. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Defendant has been extradited to Illinois.
BTC: Case dismissed.

9:28 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bradley Eddy in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Bradley Eddy. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
State of Illinois req extradition.
Defendant does not contest.
Colloquy conducted with def re: right to hearing.
BTC:  The court finds that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly, & intelligently waives extradition.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Extradition hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
